Package srg.ship

Class NavigationRoom

java.lang.Object
srg.ship.Room
srg.ship.NavigationRoom
All Implemented Interfaces:
Damageable
public class NavigationRoom extends Room
Child class of Room which represents a NavigationRoom in a Ship. NavigationRooms track the Ship's current Port and the galaxy map which lists all SpacePorts in the galaxy. NavigationRooms also track which SpacePorts the Ship could fly to (shorter distance) or jump to (longer distance).
Version:
1.2

  • Constructor Details

    • NavigationRoom

      public NavigationRoom(RoomTier roomTier, List<SpacePort> galaxyMap)
      Parameters:
      roomTier - The quality of the NavigationRoom's tier.
      galaxyMap - A List of all SpacePorts in the galaxy.

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentPort

      public SpacePort getCurrentPort()
      Returns the current port.
      Returns:
      The current SpacePort.

    • getPortsInFlyRange

      public List<SpacePort> getPortsInFlyRange()
      Returns a List of SpacePorts the Ship could fly to. This List should not include the current SpacePort.
      Returns:
      A List of Spaceports whose distance is less than or equal to the maximum flying distance.

    • getMaximumFlyDistance

      public int getMaximumFlyDistance()
      Returns:
      Maximum flying distance as an int. This is determined by the quality of the NavigationRoom, as defined by the RoomTier enum. BASIC NavigationRooms can fly 200 units. AVERAGE NavigationRooms can fly 400 units. PRIME NavigationROoms can fly 600 units.

    • getPortsInJumpRange

      public List<SpacePort> getPortsInJumpRange()
      Returns a List of SpacePorts the Ship could jump to.
      Returns:
      A List of Spaceports whose distance is greater than the maximum flying distance, but less than or equal to the maximum jumping distance.

    • getMaximumJumpDistance

      public int getMaximumJumpDistance()
      Returns:
      Maximum jump distance as an int. This is determined by the quality of the NavigationRoom, as defined by the RoomTier enum. BASIC NavigationRooms can jump 500 units. AVERAGE NavigationRooms can jump 750 units. PRIME NavigationROoms can jump 1000 units.

    • getActions

      public List<String> getActions()
      Get the list of actions that it is possible to perform from this NavigationRoom. A NavigationRoom is able to fly to SpacePorts in fly range, and jump to SpacePorts in jump range.
      Overrides:
      getActions in class Room
      Returns:
      A List of actions that this NavigationRoom can perform as Strings. Format must be: For flyable SpacePorts: "fly to \"SpacePort name\": SpacePort details [COST: amount of fuel needed TRITIUM FUEL". For jumpable SpacePorts: "jump to \" SpacePort name\" [COST: 1 HYPERDRIVE CORE]

    • getFuelNeeded

      public int getFuelNeeded(SpacePort port)
      Returns the amount of fuel required to travel to another SpacePort.
      Parameters:
      port - The SpacePort to travel to.
      Returns:
      The amount of fuel required to travel to \port. This is equal to the distance between the current Port and \port.

    • getShipYard

      public ShipYard getShipYard()
      Checks if the current port is a ShipYard.
      Returns:
      The current port as a ShipYard, if the current port is a ShipYard; null otherwise.

    • getStore

      public Store getStore()
      Checks if the current port is a Store.
      Returns:
      The current port as a Store, if the current port is a Store; null otherwise.

    • flyTo

      public void flyTo(String portName, CargoHold cargoHold) throws InsufficientResourcesException, NoPathException
      Flies the Ship to the specified SpacePort if it is in range, and the ship is able to support the journey.
      Parameters:
      portName - A String representation of the target SpacePort's unique name.
      cargoHold - The Ship's CargoHold
      Throws:
      InsufficientResourcesException - if the CargoHold is broken; if the NavigationRoom is broken; or if there is insufficient fuel of the relevant type in the CargoHold.
      NoPathException - If the named SpacePort cannot be found.

    • jumpTo

      public void jumpTo(String portName, CargoHold cargoHold) throws InsufficientResourcesException, NoPathException
      Jumps the Ship to the specified SpacePort if it is in range, and the ship is able to support the journey.
      Parameters:
      portName - A String representation of the target SpacePort's unique name.
      cargoHold - The Ship's CargoHold
      Throws:
      InsufficientResourcesException - if the CargoHold is broken; if the NavigationRoom is broken; or if there is insufficient fuel of the relevant type in the CargoHold.
      NoPathException - If the named SpacePort cannot be found.

    • getSpacePortFromName

      public SpacePort getSpacePortFromName(String name) throws NoPathException
      Parameters:
      name - The unique name of the SpacePort.
      Returns:
      The specified SpacePort if it can be found.
      Throws:
      NoPathException - If the named SpacePort cannot be found.
